contentList.categoryHeader: All Time Great foodcooking Tv Shows

listItems.title: MasterChef Junior: Season 2
listItems.description: Gordon Ramsay, Graham Elliot, and Joe Bastianich return as judges for the junior edition of Ramsay's cooking reality show.

listItems.title: Treme: Season 1
listItems.description: The newest series from the producers of The Wire is set in New Orleans three months after Hurricane Katrina as the people and the area try to rebuild.

listItems.title: The Great British Baking Show: Season 4
listItems.description: The fourth season brings another 13 bakers ready to be judged by Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood. [This is the seventh season on the original BBC broadcast under the name The Great British Bake Off. Netflix lists this season as Collection 4.]

listItems.title: Treme: Season 2
listItems.description: Season Two finds new characters seeking ways to make money as the city of New Orleans continues to recover and rebuild.

listItems.title: Waffles and Mochi: Season 1
listItems.description: Waffles and Mochi dream of becoming chefs and with the help of a supermarket owner (Michelle Obama) they travel the world learning about food and cooking.

listItems.title: Treme: Season 4
listItems.description: The final season of the drama finds New Orleans celebrating the election of Barack Obama as President and the residents hoping for opportunities after three years of struggling after the damages from Hurricane Katrina.

listItems.title: Nadiya Bakes: Season 1
listItems.description:
The Great British Baking Show winner Nadiya Hussain hosts her own baking show.

[Premiered originally in the UK on BBC Two on 12 Sep 2021; aired in US on Netflix in Feb 2021]

listItems.title: Taste the Nation with Padma Lakshmi: Season 1
listItems.description: Padma Lakshmi travels across the United States to look into the connection between food and the community it comes from.

listItems.title: Top Chef: Season 6
listItems.description: Top Chef returns for its sixth season, this time the setting is Las Vegas.

listItems.title: Ugly Delicious: Season 1
listItems.description: The documentary series follows chef David Chang and food writer Peter Meehan as they talk about food and culture while visiting restaurants from around the world.

listItems.title: Treme: Season 3
listItems.description: Set in 2007, Toni meets L.P.Everett (Chris Coy), a journalist who may help in her fight against police corruption as the people of New Orleans continue to live and survive in the Big Easy.

listItems.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy: Season 1
listItems.description: Stanley Tucci travels across Italy to explore some of the regions signature dishes in this series partially filmed in 2019 and the summer of 2020.

listItems.title: Top Chef: Season 5
listItems.description: Seventeen contestants compete for the title of Top Chef in New York City for the show's fifth season.

listItems.title: Crazy Delicious: Season 1
listItems.description:
Heston Blumenthal, Niklas Ekstedt and Carla Hall are judges in this British competitive cooking show hosted by Jayde Adams.

[Premiered in the UK on Channel 4 on 21 January 2020]

listItems.title: McMillions: Season 1
listItems.description: The six-part documentary series looks into how a security auditor exploited the McDonald's Monopoly game for over a decade, stealing $24 million in cash and prizes.

listItems.title: The Great British Baking Show: Season 9
listItems.description: Another dozen amateurs compete to be named Britain's best amateur baker as Matt Lucas takes over from Sandi Toksvig as co-host with returning co-host Noel Fielding and judges Prue Leith and Paul Hollywood. [This is actually the 11th season of the original Channel 4 broadcast under the name The Great British Bake Off. Netflix lists this season as Collection 8.]

listItems.title: Top Chef: Season 7
listItems.description: The reality show brings 17 contestants together to compete for the title of Top Chef in the nation's capitol.

listItems.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Season 1
listItems.description: Chefs may have escaped from his version of hell, but Gordon Ramsay haunts Fox with his American adaptation of his UK show of the same name.

listItems.title: Kitchen Confidential: Season 1
listItems.description: A single-camera, no-laugh-track comedy set behind the scenes in a big-time New York City restaurant, "Kitchen Confidential" is based on chef Anthony Bourdain's popular memoir.

listItems.title: Top Chef: Season 1
listItems.description: This ten-episode reality competition set in San Francisco pits a dozen aspiring chefs against each other for a $100,000 cash prize.

listItems.title: Hotel Hell: Season 1
listItems.description: The fourth series on Fox for Gordon Ramsay sees the chef attempting to rehab various inns, B&Bs, hotels, and motels throughout the United States.

listItems.title: MasterChef: Season 1
listItems.description: FOX serves up a new food competition series with Gordon Ramsay at the helm. Think American Idol in the kitchen.

listItems.title: Eat: The Story of Food: Season 1
listItems.description: The six-part documentary series explores the history of food with interviews with Graham Elliot, Eric Greenspan, Padma Lakshmi, Michael Pollan, Rachael Ray, and Jack Turner.

listItems.title: America's Next Great Restaurant: Season 1
listItems.description: The latest food-related reality series features Bobby Flay, Curtis Stone, Chef Lorena Garcia, and Chipotle's Steve Ells as judges (and potential investors) as they seek a new idea for a chain restaurant to launch in three cities.

listItems.title: Superior Donuts: Season 1
listItems.description: The comedy from Bob Daily, Neil Goldman and Garrett Donovan based on the Tracy Letts' play of the same name is about the relationship a Chicago donut shop owner (Judd Hirsch) has with his new younger employee (Jermaine Fowler) and his customers.

listItems.title: The Chew: Season 1
listItems.description: Hosted by Mario Batali, Carla Hall, Clinton Kelly, Michael Symon and Daphne Oz, the talk show focuses not only on food, but other issues that connect to it.

listItems.title: The Taste: Season 1
listItems.description: Anthony Bourdain, Nigella Lawson, Ludo Lefebvre, and Brian Malarkey mentor and judge dishes made by the 16 competitors through blind taste tests.

listItems.title: Marcel's Quantum Kitchen: Season 1
listItems.description: Top Chef alum and molecular gastronmost, Marcel Vigneron, runs a catering and event company that requires his masterful use of the science of cooking to provide food for hired events.

listItems.title: Young & Hungry: Season 1
listItems.description: Gabi (Emily Osment), a food blogger, lands an opportunity to be the personal chef for a young tech entrepreneur named Josh (Jonathan Sadowski), but she has to prove herself to his personal aide, Elliot (Rex Lee).

listItems.title: Wahlburgers: Season 1
listItems.description: The question of the expansion of the burger restaurant begun by Paul Wahlberg, the older brother of actors Donnie and Mark, is the focus of this by reality show.

listItems.title: Better Late Than Never: Season 1
listItems.description: Terry Bradshaw, Jeff Dye, George Foreman, William Shatner, and Henry Winkler travel across Asia without assistants in this remake of the South Korean series "Grandpa Over Flowers."

listItems.title: Hell's Kitchen: Season 1
listItems.description:
Aspiring young chefs are put to the ultimate challenge in Hell's Kitchen, a reality television competition starring world renowned chef Gordon Ramsay. Each of these chefs dreams of fame and fortune, but many soon find their dreams becoming nightmares. Chef Ramsay demands quality and the intensity of the challenges is beyond anything the contestants can ever imagine. Split into two teams, they must compete against each other to provide their very best in the kitchen. If they do, they are lavishly rewarded with everything from extravagant trips to a ride on Ramsay's personal yacht. Those that fail are forced to suffer humiliating punishment.

At the end of each episode, the chef who provided the best performance in Ramsay's opinion on the losing team is chosen to select two chefs from their own team for elimination. They must then give their reasons for their selection. Though one of these two chefs may be eliminated, Ramsay is under no obligation to choose either, and the final decision as to who is sent home is made solely by him.

From Waffle House chefs to executive chefs, the competitors are tested in every way possible, from leadership skills to culinary skills. Traditional challenges include a taste-test of everyone's palette and special events such as birthdays and weddings. The chefs, however, must always be on their toes, as they never know when surprises may be coming.

Watch now for the sixth season of the program, now airing every Tuesday night at 8 P.M. on FOX!

Previous season - Hell's Kitchen aired the fifth season at 9 P.M. on Thursdays In this, the fifth season, contestants competed for the position of head chef at a restaurant in the Atlantic City's Borgata Hotel Casino & Spa-- one being built specifically for the winner. This season's crop featured what executive producer Kent Weed promised to be "the best chefs we've ever assembled," with everything from a cooking-school instructor to a food-court chicken fryer. There were many contenders, but many dramatic twists as well.

You can catch repeats of various seasons of the program on FOX Reality, which has the rights to repeats of the show.

Theme Tune - "Fire" by the Ohio Players

The first season of Hell's Kitchen is now available in stores across the United States on DVD. The DVD is billed as "raw and uncensored" and also features bonuses such as cast and crew interviews & a tour of the Hell's Kitchen set. And if you enjoy Hell's Kitchen, you might also enjoy Kitchen Nightmares, as well as Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares, available in the United States on BBC America.

listItems.title: Feed the Beast (2016): Season 1
listItems.description: Best friends Tommy Moran (David Schwimmer) and Dion Patras (Jim Sturgess struggle to open their own restaurant in this drama series based on the Danish show Bankerot.

listItems.title: Around the World in 80 Plates: Season 1
listItems.description: 12 chefs race over 40 days to cook in 10 different countries (Argentina, China, England, France, Italy, Morocco, Spain, Thailand, United States and Uruguay) in this show hosted by Curtis Stone and Cat Cora.

listItems.title: The Chopping Block: Season 1
listItems.description: Gordan Ramsey's former boss Marco Pierre White gets into the cooking reality TV business with a team competition to win $250,000 to open a restaurant.
